titleStmt.title: Verses ty'd about a Fawn's Neck, which was presented to a very young Lady, call'd by her Friends the Ivory Maid.
titleStmt.author: Constantine Barber

bibl.title: Verses ty'd about a Fawn's Neck, which was presented to a very young Lady, call'd by her Friends the Ivory Maid.
bibl.author: Constantine Barber

front.head: Verses ty'd about a Fawn's Neck, which was presented to a very young Lady, call'd by her Friends the Ivory Maid.

lg.l: thro' this sylvan Scene I stray'd,
And hearing that she fled from Man,
I begg'd this Form of mighty ;
To try, by ev'ry winning Art,
To gain Possession of her Heart;
When raging Tempests cloud the Sky,
Transported at her Feet to lie;
To trip it o'er the Lawns together.
